messages.message:
I’m getting a 502 on the crafting cluster itself — is this a known issue?
https://crafting-aihub.test.instabase.com/
Yah my personal sandbox is getting a 502 as well

deployment manager is giving a 504 as well =(
https://crafting-aihub.test.instabase.com/deployment-manager/
hm not. 502, but it just does not return any webpage
cc <!subteam^S02FJA6A7U5>

```An error occurred (ResourceNotFoundException) when calling the DescribeCluster operation: No cluster found for name: insan-use2-crafting-aihub-eks-cluster.```
When i try to connect to the cluster
Is it possible it was entirely deleted?
<!subteam^S08AA13VAFQ>, anything happened recently?
that's the wrong cluster haha, it's `intes-use2-crafting-aihub-eks-cluster` -- you also don't need to request an EKS config, the cluster is reachable by default with kubectl from any sandbox
I'm taking a look now but I'm not aware of any changes that have gone in recently
haha mb
thanks for taking a look
ah, looks like the cluster is being upgraded, I think this is just temporary downtime while the upgrade rolls out
merp nope, I'm wrong, there aren't any active rollouts afaict :thonk: I do see a bunch of pods still trying to come up though -- anyone know if someone adjusted k8s resources manually recently?
mmm looks like envoy isn't passing readiness checks on most containers, could be a problem with mesh manager
....or not, seems to be running fine :upside_down_face: I'm going to trigger an upgrade in case it helps reset things

I am very unsure of what's going on, but it seems tied to these logs being spewed everywhere by envoy
```[warning][config] [./source/common/config/grpc_stream.h:201] StreamAggregatedResources gRPC config stream to mesh_manager closed since 478s ago: 14, upstream connect error or disconnect/reset before headers. reset reason: connection failure```
I forgot to update this but this has been resolved about an hour ago. Thanks @sean.donohoe @Arek!
oh was that you @Paul H? I thought the cluster just magically came back after I restarted calico enough times :sweat_smile:
I didn’t do anything, so it was definitely magic :sparkles:
turn it off and on again
